newsitem.title: UK: Euro straight-runs steady, boosted by better crude.
newsitem.headline: Euro straight-runs steady, boosted by better crude.

text.p: European straight-run sellers were encouraged on Tuesday by crude's strength and recent sales at healthy numbers, traders said.
Offer numbers were around $100-$99 fob for typical 0.5-0.7 percent material. One small physical deal was seen within Britain, with the price not immediately available.
Russian straight-runs were meeting good buying interest, traders said, with E-4 premiums at about $3 above the three means.
In the Mediterranean an Eygptian cargo was on offer, as were a smattering of Russians, some of which were being targeted towards the bunker market, dealers said.
